metadata.description: Hybrid stakeholder taxonomy combining MAPS-aligned constraints with statistical simulation capabilities for Medical Affairs Intelligence Platform
metadata.design_philosophy: Merge deterministic compliance guardrails (v3.0) with probabilistic weighting system (v2.0) for both strategic planning and Monte Carlo simulation
design_principles: Explicit cascades with probabilistic weights (enables both deterministic planning and stochastic simulation)
Enumerations with statistical distributions for consistency and flexibility
Region archetypes with bounded overrides and regional modifiers
Stakeholder relationship graphs for network analysis
Temporal and scenario-based modulation for dynamic planning
Claim discipline: stakeholder relevance does not imply impact claims

direct: pillars.json - strategy pillar enablement/blocking based on stakeholder constraints
channels.json - channel viability scoring per stakeholder and region
metrics.json - valid metric levels for measurement claims
indirect: execution_plans.json - aggregated stakeholder weights influence resource allocation
risk_assessment.json - compliance risk and reputational risk aggregation
budget_models.json - engagement complexity influences cost modeling
relationship_maps.json - stakeholder network for influence analysis
simulation: monte_carlo_engine - weight distributions enable probabilistic scenario planning
network_propagation - relationship graphs enable influence cascade modeling
temporal_forecasting - seasonal and lifecycle factors enable time-series planning

version_history.changes: Closed stakeholder graph; added missing stakeholder stubs referenced by relationships; introduced relationship_concepts for non-stakeholder entities; updated stakeholder_index.

weighting_system.base_formula: final_weight = base_weight × therapy_modifier × region_modifier × regulatory_complexity_modifier × lifecycle_modifier × competitive_modifier × scenario_modifier

therapy_area_modifier.description: Multiplier based on therapeutic area complexity and stakeholder engagement intensity

region_modifier.description: Multiplier based on regional market importance and engagement sophistication

regulatory_complexity_modifier.description: Multiplier based on regulatory environment complexity

lifecycle_stage_modifier.description: Multiplier based on product lifecycle stage and associated stakeholder engagement needs

market_access_stage_modifier.description: Multiplier based on market access journey stage

competitive_intensity_modifier.description: Multiplier based on competitive positioning and differentiation needs

scenario_modifiers.description: Temporary multipliers applied during specific scenarios to adjust stakeholder importance dynamically

UK.notes: ABPI-driven environment; high governance and transparency expectations

EU.notes: EFPIA rail; member-state variability in implementation

US.notes: PhRMA rail; high transparency reporting expectations (Sunshine Act) and different engagement norms

Eastern_Europe.notes: Mixed EU/non-EU systems; access and data maturity vary widely; relationship-mediated engagement common

LATAM.notes: Higher relationship mediation and heterogeneous system centralization; price controls common

SE_Asia_Emerging.notes: Emerging-market heterogeneity; variable data maturity and channel dominance; rapid digital adoption

Middle_East.notes: High role of government institutions; relationship-mediated access is common; growing digital sophistication

healthcare_professionals.description: Direct patient care providers and clinical experts

market_access_payers.description: Payers, HTA agencies, and access decision makers

digital_health.description: Digital health platforms and technology providers

cascade_contract.description: Defines how stakeholder taxonomy fields cascade to other JSON schemas in the sAÏmone ecosystem

pillar_tags.mechanism: cascade.enables_pillar_tags and cascade.blocks_pillar_tags filter which strategic pillars can be assigned to activities involving this stakeholder

tactic_families.mechanism: cascade.eligible_tactic_families and cascade.ineligible_tactic_families constrain which tactical approaches are valid for this stakeholder

channel_families.mechanism: constraints.channel_viability scores propagate to channel selection algorithms

metric_levels.mechanism: cascade.valid_metric_levels bounds what measurement claims can be made (e.g., can only measure activity/output for regulators, not outcomes)

weight_distributions.mechanism: importance.weight_distribution feeds into Monte Carlo simulations for resource allocation

temporal_factors.mechanism: temporal_factors modulate stakeholder importance over time windows
